articles.content:
Modern stock farm on outskirts of Pyongyang 
    Pyongyang, July 10 (KCNA) -- There is a modern stock farm in Kubin-ri of Kangdong county, Pyongyang. Dairy products from its milk-processing shop including kefir cheese and yogurt are popular not only at sports, public health and educational institutions in Pyongyang but at foreign embassies here. They are expected to be best sellers at home and abroad.

articles.content:
Korean people's cause supported
     Pyongyang, July 10 (KCNA) -- Kim Pong Gi, DPRK Ambassador to Burundi, presented his credentials to Pierre Buyoya, President of Burundi, on June 28.
 Recalling with deep emotion that President Kim Il Sung met him each time when he visited the DPRK two times, the Burundian President said that Kim Il Sung was a saviour who made a great contribution to the building of a new society by Burundi and other African people.    
 He congratulated the Korean people on their steady victories and progress made in their efforts for socialist construction and the reunification of the country under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Il and extended solidarity to them. 
 Noting that the army-based policy of Kim Jong Il guarantees the dignity and might of socialist Korea, he expressed full support to the Korean people in their struggle to protect the socialist cause and the dignity of the country.

Kim Yong Nam leaves for foreign tour
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam leaves for foreign tour
    Pyongyang, July 10 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, President of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, today left Pyongyang by a special plane to pay an official good-will visit to the Republic of Indonesia, the Great Socialist People's Libyan Arab Jamahiriya and the Ayrian Arab Republic.
 Accompanying him were Foreign Minister Paek Nam Sun, Minister of Foreign Trade Ri Kwang Gun, president of the Academy of Sciences Ri Kwang Ho, acting chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries Mun Jae Chol, and other suite members.    
 They were seen off at the airport by Yang Hyong Sop, vice-President of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, first vice-Minister of Foreign Affairs Kang Sok Ju, officials concerned and Indonesian, Libyan and Syrian charges d' affaires ad interim here.

Greetings to President of Mongolia
articles.content:
Greetings to President of Mongolia
    Pyongyang, July 10 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, President of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, today sent a message of greetings to Natsagiin Bagabandi, President of Mongolia, on the occasion of the 81st anniversary of the victory in the Mongolian People's Revolution.
 Hoping for a new success in the work of the president and the people of Mongolia for the prosperity of the country, the message expressed conviction that the traditional friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger in the future.
